messages.message: I just had a call with a prospect who mentioned that "Research Mode" in Converse, sounds like it's for training the model on their data. Which obviously he was against. Not sure if you had that feedback before.

Never heard that before but interesting feedback.
Were you able to explain to the customer that "Research" mode really refers to the model 'researching' how to resolve the given query or task? It will basically try to create its own steps to find a solution.

Meanwhile, non-research mode uses a standardized track of steps to resolve the task.
yes, all clear now with the prospect.

I had no idea that's what research stands for... I thought it was IB research teams most experimental and cutting edge models or something (I knew it was MS and things just hadn't understood the naming logic)
Our documentation talks in detail about this - https://docs.instabase.com/overview/models#multistep-model-and-research-mode
